parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of an obsolete primary of the same meaning; to show.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A denarius, a small Roman silver coin. Of Latin origin; a denarius.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.
An image, likeness, bust. From eiko; a likeness, i.e. statue, profile, or representation, resemblance.
An inscription, title, label. From epigrapho; an inscription.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Of Latin origin; Caesar, a title of the Roman emperor.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
